commitmsg:
Merge pull request #1 from JSilver99/TestSuite

Add a test suite for API; r=dmose.
Changed the tests to not require vows in your path, changed some 'beer' comments to 'GameSaver' comments.
Forgot to add back in the Makefile to git after the rename.
Fixed most of the issues recently commented on
Fixed spacing on save-test.js
Got a prototype version of a saving/loading test ready.
Started work on the GameSaver server Test Suite.

Merge pull request #1 from JSilver99/TicTacToe

JSON GameSaver server prototype, with Tic Tac Toe prototype as basic API validation.

Merge pull request #1 from jbraffoul/TicTacToe

Tic tac toe
fixed a syntax error that broke compatability in Chrome for example TicTacToe game.
Changed the save/load buttons to actual buttons, and made them hidden/visible based on if they're logged in, and if they database is currently empty for the selected Game+Email pair.
Added a log out button to the test game so we can test everything.
Created a simple Tic Tac Toe test game with a history of games played to test saving and loading. Also started doing a working prototype of saving/loading based on myfavoritebeer.org.
Add .project to .gitignore
Add a dummy HTML file for an example game
Make the top portion of overview clearer
Update the overview to be clear about what we're trying to do here.
bump up to latest cookie-session library which fixes cookie timestamps
clear input field when logging out
change the way we interface cookie session stuff so that expiry is properly updated every time a cookie is issued.  works around an upstream bug.
more typos.  s/resp/res/

Merge pull request #22 from shane-tomlinson/null_assertion_nosignin

Only do the login request if assertion !== null closes #19

Merge pull request #21 from shane-tomlinson/signin_opacity

When adding the sign in button, set the opacity to 1.0. closes #20

Only request login if the assertion is not null.

issue #19
Merge branch 'dev' into signin_opacity
Merge branch 'master' into dev

When adding the sign in button, set the opacity to 1.0.

This is because if the button was already there, it is not replaced and redrawn but reused with it's former opacity of 0.5

issue #20.
fix typo, reference to incorrect variable
language tweaks in README
Write a README that explains how this thing works
make it so the code can run without a configured database for simpler local development
when user logs out, hide all logged in content (now that we don't use page refreshes at logout)
annotate all code with better explanations of what's what.
complete server based beer persistence
express full version number of mongo dependency
a database abstraction layer for mongo db to persist beer
whitespace change
add substitution logic to vary the browserid server we use depending on the host header.  allows one installation to server beta, dev, and production
upgrade to postprocess 0.0.2 which fixes serving of binary files, also add a start script so npm start just works
compress the beer image.  800k is redonkulous
be smarter about determining what the 'audience' parameter should be to the verifier, that is how our client is referring to us
add log (console) messages during verification
add a Procfile for running under foreman (heroku friendly)
handle malformed JSON response from verifier gracefully
Merge shane's changes in.
remove console logging in web resources.
allow IP to be specified in an environment variable
Merge branch 'login_logout_message' into dev
Using document.addEventListener to bind events.
Merge branch 'specify_ip_address' into dev

Adding the ability to specify the IP Address to listen on.

Useful when trying to debug from a remote machine or VM and you need to listen on an address other than localhost.

Merge remote branch 'origin/straight_to_beer' into dev

Conflicts:
	static/js/main.js
Merge branch 'ie8_styling' into dev

Adding html5shim for IE<8.

Only included for IE<8.

Do not show either intro or the 'business' until authentication status.

This gives a much smoother experience if 'whoami' takes a second or so to complete by no longer flashing up the intro.

Perhaps we should show a "loading" message as well.

Merge pull request #9 from shane-tomlinson/semantic_html

Cleaning up the HTML/CSS a bit.

Merge pull request #10 from shane-tomlinson/serverchanges

Server changes
sessions last for two *hours*, not two *minutes*
Logout now calls the server's logout, which clears the session's email.
Saving off the email when it is established for a session so that we can do a whoami.
Now saving the email and displaying the gravatar correctly

We can now log in!  Correctly getting the assertion, passing back decoded data.

Decoded data is now displayed, login changes.
Use the correct host ipaddress/port when doing the verification
Fixing the URL replacement as well as who we verify against if we specify an alternate myfavoritebeer.org
Cleaning up the HTML/CSS a bit.
typo, part 2
fix typo
incremental work towards making a proper demo out of myfavoritebeer.
stub out a very simple server for myfavoritebeer.org
use $.bind for IE compatibility
contact the verifier over POST rather than GET, keeps user identifiable information out of HTTP logs

Merge pull request #1 from rossbruniges/master

(lth: ok, sadly maybe it's time to give it up.  Blink had its time on stage)  The <blink> was getting a little annoying :)

Merge pull request #3 from michiel-unhosted/patch-3

add warning about client-side vs. server-side verification
ref. http://groups.google.com/group/mozilla.dev.identity/browse_thread/thread/36424f9f63dffb60#
no more >blink>ing
sketch native browserid support - listen for login/logout events, and fiddle navigator.id.sessions to signal browser that we want to opt in
transparency is phun
add a logout button
pseudo persistence, all done
enough to demo, isn't it?
sell it, baby
language.
a little more subtle background.  andy... halp...
style and a footer
some styling
whitespace
basic trivial first cut
overview
myfavoritebeer.org, origin.
